greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle giving maximal permanent P(n,k) of an n X n lower Hessenberg (0,1)-matrix with exactly k 1's for n >= 3 and 2n < k <= (8n)/3, read by rows.
link: D. D. Olesky, B. L. Shader and P. van den Driessche, Permanents of Hessenberg (0,1)-matrices, Electronic Journal of Combinatorics, 12 (2005) #R70.
B. Shader Table of known values of P(n,k) for n<=12.
formula: P(n, k) = 2^(n-1) - (s(1) + s(2) + ... + s(h(n)-k)) where s(k) is the sequence A113452.
results.author: Bryan Shader (bshader(AT)uwyo.edu), Jan 07 2006
